results.title: Herding cattle on the Niger
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “African village life”.
Illustrates how the West African Peul (or Fulani) tribesmen tend their cattle, wandering from one grazing land to another. Shows them driving their herd across the Niger River. No spoken word. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Hercules returns
results.creator_credit: Philm Productions, Philip Jaroslow and David Parker
results.brief_description: After resigning from their jobs, 2 film company executives (David Argue and Bruce Spence) open a revival theatre. On their grand opening they plan to screen the Italian epic, “Hercules”, the film that closed the theatre down. Their ex-boss exacts revenge by sending them the wrong print; an Italian one with no subtitles. With little or no means for rectifying the situation, they make do with what they have at hand and dub the voices themselves. What eventuates is a dramatic departure from the original version, which becomes set in Climidia, with Hercules a cabaret singer and a supporting cast that includes Labia, Testiculi and Machismo. Developed from the live show, “Double take meets Hercules”, written and directed by Des Mangan. Cast includes David Argue, Bruce Spence, Mary Coustas and Michael Carman.

results.title: Hercules (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Morton Schindel
results.brief_description: Based on the story by Hardie Gramatky published in 1940, the most modern of fire engines is forced into retirement because of automation. Illustrated by Hardie Gramatky.

results.title: Hercules (Disney)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Alice Dewey, John Musker and Ron Clements
results.brief_description: Zeus and Hera’s son, Hercule’s is stolen by the henchmen of the evil Hades. He manages to survive and is sent to earth to live as a mere mortal, his parents watching from the heavens. Life on earth isn’t happy for Hercules, he’s ridiculed about his strength and nicknamed ‘Jerkules’. On a journey to discover his identity he finds out that he is a son of the gods, but to regain a place in heaven he has to prove himself a hero on earth. The task is not as easy as he first thought, with a beautiful damsel, Meg, manipulated by Hades trying to make him fail. Through attempting to prove himself a hero, Hercules discovers that being famous may gain him a place in heaven but love on earth is more rewarding. Features the voices of Tate Donovan, Danny De Vito, Susan Egan, Rip Torn, Samantha Eggar, Bobcat Goldthwait and Charlton Heston as the narrator.

results.title: Hercules
results.brief_description: Hercules is a little fire engine pulled by horses and is happy working with his three human friends - Hokey, Pokey and Smokey. One day Hercules is called to a fire, but is beaten there by new motorised fire engines. Hercules is ashamed and eventually replaced by the faster engines, until one day he is called upon to save the day. Based on the book written by Hardie Gramatky.

results.title: Herbie rides again
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Walsh and Robert Stevenson
results.brief_description: Another adventure with the VW with a mind of its own; Herbie. In this escapade Herbie comes to the assistance of a little old lady. They combine their efforts to stop a tycoon from building the world’s highest building on her property. Starring Helen Hayes, Ken Berry, Stefanie Powers, John McIntire and Keenan Wynn. Based on a story by Gordon Buford, screenplay by Bill Walsh.

results.title: Herbal Medicine -Fact or Fiction
results.brief_description: Examines the use of herbs as medicine in third world countries, particularly in Mexico, and suggests that herbal medicine has an important role to play in conjunction with Western medicine.

results.title: Herb Elliott says 'Take five and stay alive'
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Herb Elliott is shown breaking the four minute mile and discussing his training. Just as poor training and condition can cause an injury which will put a runner out for the season, so a faulty motor and bad driving can put a driver and others out, perhaps for life.

results.title: Herald Sun Occupation
results.creator_credit: SKA TV, Campbell Manderson and Pip Starr
results.brief_description: During the World Economic Forum (WEF) held in Melbourne in September 2000, a group of protesters went to the Herald Sun newspaper to voice their concern the paper’s exceptionally biased coverage of the protests outside the WEF. Screened as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.
